name: Daniel Axelson
role: Software Developer, Penetration Tester and Beginner Bug Bounty Hunter
tagline: Developing for small startups, public institutions, and personal projects.
about: I am a versatile developer and junior pentester with experience working on solutions for public institutions. My work spans both front-end and back-end development, with a strong focus on building secure, reliable, and maintainable systems.

I enjoy tackling a wide range of technical challenges and learning new technologies as I go. As a jack-of-all-trades, I adapt quickly, explore modern frameworks, and continuously develop my skills while keeping a solid foundation in core software engineering and cybersecurity principles.

experience.time: Aug 2023 – Present • Oslo, Norway • On-site & Remote
experience.summary: Built a voting platform for a school awards event, focusing on making the solution easy to maintain by non-developers. Worked across frontend, backend, and server configuration.

Basic Permission, and access control using intune, azure, and IDA. Also doing pc repairs & maintenance, as well as some helpdesk support. Local Network administration using switches, firewalls and access points.
One‑week internship doing web development by migrating from wix as well as basic SEO tasks.

experience.time: Oct 2024 – Oct 2024 & Jan 2025 - Feb 2025 • Oslo, Norway • On-site
experience.summary: In total a four‑week internship wiping PCs for sensitive data, repairing hardware, helping customers with technical issues, and setting up new devices for customers. Also did some courera certifications and network setup.

projects.name: 3D Sudoku
